sen.j: 鷹司 隆子（たかつかさ たかこ、天明7年4月28日 (旧暦)（1787年6月13日） - 明治3年6月8日 (旧暦)（1870年7月6日））は江戸時代の女性。
sen.e: Takako TAKATSUKASA (June 13, 1787 - July 6, 1870) was a woman, who lived during the Edo Period.
Takako TAKATSUKASA (June 13, 1787 - July 6, 1870) was a woman in the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 前置詞はduringよりinの方が適切です。
sen.e: Takako TAKATSUKASA (June 13, 1787 - July 6, 1870) was a woman in the Edo Period.

sen.j: 関白鷹司政煕の女、母は家女房。
sen.e: She was the daughter of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, and her mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
She was a daughter of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, and her mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
sen.cmt: 「娘」は一人とは限らないのでtheではなくaにします。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, and her mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
Her name was Akihime
Her name was Akihime
Her name was Akihime

sen.j: 弟に鷹司政通、姉妹に仁孝天皇皇后の新皇嘉門院（鷹司繁子）、同じく女御の新朔平門院（鷹司祺子）、将軍徳川家定正室の鷹司任子、閑院宮孝仁親王妃の鷹司吉子、伏見宮邦家親王妃の鷹司景子がいる。
sen.e: Masamichi TAKATSUKASA was her younger brother, and her sisters were as follows: wife of Emperor Ninko (Empress), Shinko (posthumous title that means new emperor) Kamonin (Tsunako TAKATSUKASA); nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court [a consort of an emperor]) Shinsakuheimonin; lawful wife of Shogun Iesada TOKUGAWA, Ninshi TAKATSUKASA; wife of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito, Princess Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA; wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, Princess Hiroko TAKATSUKASA.
sen.cmt: 鷹司吉子→Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA (Chikako TAKATSUKASAとも読むようです）。
sen.e: Masamichi TAKATSUKASA was her younger brother, and her sisters were as follows: a wife of Emperor Ninko (Empress), Shinko (posthumous title that means a new emperor) Kamonin (Tsunako TAKATSUKASA); nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court [a consort of an emperor]) Shinsakuheimonin; the lawful wife of Shogun Iesada TOKUGAWA, Ninshi TAKATSUKASA; a wife of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito, Princess Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA; a wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, Princess Hiroko TAKATSUKASA.

Masamichi TAKATSUKASA was her younger brother, and her sisters were as follows: a wife of Emperor Ninko (Empress), Shinko (posthumous title that means a new emperor) Kamonin (Tsunako TAKATSUKASA); nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court [a consort of an emperor]) Shinsakuheimonin; the lawful wife of Shogun Iesada TOKUGAWA, Ninshi TAKATSUKASA; a wife of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito, Princess Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA; a wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, Princess Hiroko TAKATSUKASA.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)4年（1807年〉に加賀藩十二代藩主前田斉広に輿入れする。
sen.e: In 1807, she married into the 12th lord of Kaga Domain, Narinaga MAEDA.
In 1807, she married into the 12th lord of Kaga Domain, Narinaga MAEDA.
In 1807, she married into the 12th lord of Kaga Domain, Narinaga MAEDA.

sen.j: 斉広との間には1女・直（小笠原忠徴婚約者）が生まれた。
sen.e: She had a daughter named Nao (直) (Tadaakira OGASAWARA's fiancee) with Narinaga.
sen.cmt: 直→正式な読み方が不明です：Nao (直)としました。
sen.e: She had a daughter named Nao (直), who later became Tadaakira OGASAWARA's fiancee, with Narinaga.
sen.cmt: 「後に婚約者となる」と補った方が自然な流れだと思います。
sen.e: She had a daughter named Nao (直), who later became Tadaakira OGASAWARA's fiancee, with Narinaga.

sen.j: 夫斉広の死後は眞龍院と称し、金沢で過ごす。
sen.e: After the death of her husband Narinaga, she lived the rest of her life in Kanazawa.
After the death of her husband Narinaga, she named herself Shinryuin and lived in Kanazawa for the rest of her life.
sen.cmt: 「眞龍院と称し」の訳漏れを修正しました。
sen.e: After the death of her husband Narinaga, she named herself Shinryuin and lived in Kanazawa for the rest of her life.

sen.j: 重用文化財指定の成巽閣は十三代藩主前田斉泰によって隆子のために建てられたものである。
sen.e: Seisonkaku Villa, designated as an important cultural property, was built for Takako by the 13th lord of domain, Nariyasu MAEDA.
Seisonkaku Villa, designated as an important cultural property, was built for Takako by the 13th lord of domain, Nariyasu MAEDA.
Seisonkaku Villa, designated as an important cultural property, was built for Takako by the 13th lord of domain, Nariyasu MAEDA.
